subject: Re: [junit] JUnit 4 restructuring
msgSnippet: ... There s a large difference between the wise human mentor, who will occasionally say to even the most inexperienced mentee Yes, you re right, I hadn t
messageBody:
Elliotte Harold wrote:

> Libraries are by their nature patronizing. [...]
>
> While some developers don't need baby-sitting, most do. In fact, let me
> dequalify that: All developers need to be baby sat. However we more
> politely call it "mentoring", " code review", and "pair programming"
> rather than baby sitting.

There's a large difference between the wise human mentor, who will
occasionally say to even the most inexperienced mentee "Yes, you're
right, I hadn't thought of that", and a released library, in which the
answer is ordained before the question is asked. Perhaps a humble
library writer might look for ways to have that answer not always be "No"?

David Saff
